meanings.definition: A unit of currency in North Korea.
meanings.sent1: In North Korea, you can buy many things with a chon.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for chon at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper only accepted chon, so I had to find a currency exchange.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand chon.
meanings.sent5: The shiny chon coins jingled in his pocket.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a person's head.
meanings.sent1: He bumped his chon on the low doorway.
meanings.sent2: She rested her weary head on the soft chon.
meanings.sent3: Carrying all those books made his chon feel heavier.
meanings.sent4: The idea popped into his chon like a light bulb.
meanings.sent5: Her chon was filled with dreams of adventure.

meanings.definition: A type of fish commonly found in the Pacific Ocean.
meanings.sent1: The chon swam gracefully among the coral reefs.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen caught a large chon for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The chon seemed to wink at me from the aquarium.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like a school of chon.
meanings.sent5: The chon's scales shimmered in the sunlight.
